messages.message:
:wave: Hi, new hire here, going through our engineering environment setup doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yQOCxOISV_ukUxXdPJDoN-rERtOhdVRe7zv1swF1igw/edit#) got some conflicting messages about mypy version and wonder if we should update our doc:
the `update-python` make target under `tools/devtools` is pointing to a specific version of foundation that requires mypy==0.790 (https://github.com/instabase/foundation/blob/15c665b9c9f7d3722d1b3ed9a92f1ce0d94c05b8/setup.py) but our doc seems to suggest to install mypy==0.701, so I ended up getting the following warning message:
```instabase-foundation 0.0.3 requires mypy==0.790, but you have mypy 0.701 which is incompatible.```
instabase-foundation is a deprecated project, so that dependency isn’t required anymore. we should be on 0.701
@lydia can we remove foundation from our requirements?
oh I just saw the comments regarding foundation installs the wrong mypy version here in python37-install-dev.sh
I think we should also be removing foundation from all our dockerfiles, looks like it’s pulled into a coupls: jenkins api-server-apps.
Is it just to remove the references? If so I can take shot on this.
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/24691 the tests seem to run a little bit...too fast :sweat_smile:
and I just found the code style doc, and reading it now
